Task:
  The response changes the representation or form while preserving underlying meaning and semantic equivalence.
constraints: Completeness ("full"): The response provides a thorough answer for normal use, covering all major aspects without needing every micro-detail.
Form ("adr"): The response takes the shape of an Architecture Decision Record (ADR) with sections for context, decision, and consequences, written in a concise document style.
Channel ("sync"): The response takes the shape of a synchronous or live session plan (agenda, steps, cues) rather than static reference text.
Directional ("fly bog"): The response identifies abstract patterns and general principles, examines their structure and reflects on it, then identifies actions and extends them to related contexts.
